text: my background started in helping people
with diabetes so I was working on
machine vision research helping
researchers figure out new novel ways to
track nerves and back of the eye my
co-founder was one of the first in the
industry with a title game designer at a
company called Atari so the two of us
teamed up a guy with machine vision
experience background and a guy with
game design background and what we
actually pioneered was a fraud fighting
tool that combats it in much the way
that fraudsters will go about kind of
cheating an online game so fraudsters in
games are trying to take advantage of
things like how fast they can move that
they can overcome obstacles if they can
automatically farm objects in game and
what their ultimate idea and ultimate
outcome they're looking to do is create
some kind of money right so they're
automatically playing these games with
bots and scripts so they can farm goals
in game to then sell it on a third party
website same applies to when you're
trying to breach a big website like a
retail website trying to get into
someone's account can take money out or
you know there's other virtual economies
where they're trying to abuse like
auction houses online to extract some
kind of monetary incentive we built was
a solution that actually lets us
increase the cost of these attacks and
what the goal is is if we can raise the
cost of trying to get into these
accounts and into these websites and you
can actually make it more expensive than
the money they can extract you've
actually won they actually give up and
go away because now they're not making
any car away anymore so for example with
our airline customers it's actually
competitive airlines that are making
attacks they're using scripts they go
through and book a seat and then they'll
go to the checkout page the script is
doing this automatically it'll choose a
payment redirection method like Ali pay
or PayPal which takes you off the
website to make the transaction and they
actually never buy and what the website
does it holds the seat momentarily
whilst waiting for that return request
it's a denial of inventory so now when
you do a search for inventory from that
airline they no longer visible at all
so it looks like that entire airline
sold out for 1415 days in advance and
now you'll buy tickets from the
competitor so I think I'm really proud
of our effort to ensure that there's a
really good balance of having you know
Loctite security but also the user
experience is not impacted through that
journey as they're trying to log into an
account or trying to check out on a
website it's super critical that that
user experience is not interrupted and
that extends beyond things because we're
presenting challenges to malicious
traffic that extends to things like
accessibility requirements we have a
huge investment in making sure even
users with accessibility needs can get
through as well
[Music]
